SEARCH
Package edu.ncsu.csc216.app_manager.model.manager

Class AppManager

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.app_manager.model.manager.AppManager
public class AppManager extends Object
The AppManager class is responsible for managing the application's data and interacting with the AppList. It follows a Singleton pattern, ensuring only one instance of the AppManager exists throughout the application lifecycle. This class provides methods to save and load application data to/from files, create new application lists, retrieve applications by their type or ID, and execute commands on applications.
Author:
Priyanshu Dongre

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static AppManager getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the AppManager. If the instance does not exist, it is created.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of AppManager.

    • saveAppsToFile

      public void saveAppsToFile(String fileName)
      Saves the current application list to the specified file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to save the applications to.

    • loadAppsFromFile

      public void loadAppsFromFile(String fileName)
      Loads applications from a specified file into the current application list.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to load applications from.

    • createNewAppList

      public void createNewAppList()
      Creates a new application list, resetting any existing data.

    • getAppListAsArray

      public Object[][] getAppListAsArray()
      Retrieves the application list as a 2D array for easy display in tables.
      Returns:
      a 2D array of application data.

    • getAppListAsArrayByAppType

      public Object[][] getAppListAsArrayByAppType(String type)
      Retrieves applications of the specified type as a 2D array.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of applications to filter by (e.g., NEW, OLD).
      Returns:
      a 2D array of application data filtered by type.

    • getAppById

      public Application getAppById(int id)
      Retrieves an application by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the application to retrieve.
      Returns:
      the application with the specified ID, or null if not found.

    • executeCommand

      public void executeCommand(int id, Command command)
      Executes a command on an application, updating its state based on the command.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the application to update.
      command - the command to execute on the application.

    • deleteAppById

      public void deleteAppById(int id)
      Deletes an application by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the application to delete.

    • addAppToList

      public void addAppToList(Application.AppType appType, String summary, String note)
      Adds a new application to the application list.
      Parameters:
      appType - the type of the application (e.g., NEW, OLD, HIRED).
      summary - a brief summary of the application.
      note - additional notes related to the application.
